alert.note: Alert for Burke (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 8:08PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Burke County through 900 PM EDT... At 808 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bartow, or near Louisville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Plant Vogtle, Sardis, Alexander, Gough, Burke County Airport, Girard, Vidette, Shell Bluff, Di- Lane Wildlife Management Area, Magruder and Rosier. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
